ProjectsPage.bio: I am a developer with a strong focus on building web services that users can intuitively understand and conveniently use. With experience in React.js, Next.js, and Node.js, I have worked on solving problems through a UI/UX-centered approach and delivering high-quality services. My goal is to grow into a developer who not only implements features but also maximizes the value of the user experience.

ProjectsPage.coreBeliefTitle: C O R E  B E L I E F S

coreBeliefsList.title: Continuous Growth
coreBeliefsList.description: Technology and design are constantly evolving. I strive to keep learning, improving, and creating better outcomes without ever standing still.

coreBeliefsList.title: User-Centered Mindset
coreBeliefsList.description: Every project begins with the user. I design and build with empathy, aiming to deliver intuitive and meaningful experiences.

coreBeliefsList.title: Collaboration & Trust
coreBeliefsList.description: Great services are not built alone but together. I value open collaboration and believe trust is the foundation for achieving shared goals.

ProjectsPage.interviewTitle: I N T E R V I E W

interviewsList.title: Why did you apply for a frontend developer position?
interviewsList.description: I started programming with C and Java, but soon lost interest as the results were not immediately visible. In contrast, web development fascinated me because the output was reflected on the screen as soon as I wrote the code. This led me to broaden my understanding of the web through clone coding and various learning resources. Later, while exploring how backend data could be integrated into the frontend, I joined a full-stack bootcamp, where I gained systematic knowledge of how the frontend and backend are structured and interact through several team projects. During this process, I experienced the role of a full-stack developer who can handle all areas, but I eventually realized that the field I excel in and truly enjoy is frontend development. This is why I decided to apply as a frontend developer.

interviewsList.title: What is your greatest strength as a frontend developer?
interviewsList.description: My greatest strength is the ability to clearly understand and implement UI/UX. While writing efficient and well-structured code is important, I believe the most critical aspect lies in the interface users interact with and the user experiences they have throughout that process. Based on this perspective, I have always focused on designing user-centered screens and interactions. In particular, I often took the lead in frontend roles during team projects, driving UI/UX decisions, and consistently received positive feedback about my contributions in peer reviews. I am confident that this ability to prioritize and deliver strong user experiences is my greatest strength.

interviewsList.title: What efforts have you made for self-development?
interviewsList.description: I have consistently devoted myself to self-development in order to grow as a frontend developer. I systematically acquired knowledge and skills through online courses and bootcamps, and strengthened my practical understanding by repeatedly practicing CRUD implementations and working with various libraries and frameworks. Whenever I encountered challenges or had questions during the learning process, I immediately organized them and sought advice from experienced developers to deepen my understanding. These habits have allowed me to quickly learn and apply new technologies, and have helped me grow into a developer who can confidently take on professional responsibilities.
